intro: Pedicularis inconspicua, commonly known as the common lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, often on rocky slopes or in meadows. Its flowers are small and usually pink or purple, with a distinctive spurred shape. It is characterized by its erect stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs.
